eng_comment: I pre-ordered a cake and was scheduled to pick it up on April 11th. When I entered the shop, I felt dissatisfied as the staff did not greet me and were sitting with their backs to the door. I had to go all the way inside to be greeted, which felt very disrespectful. I had pre-ordered, so if there were any issues, the shop should have called to inform me. The shop's way of handling the situation was very unprofessional. The cashier told me that due to a machine malfunction, the cake I ordered was not available and asked me to choose another cake. Why was there no solution when the machine malfunctioned? At that moment, I remained silent because I was afraid I wouldn't be calm and might say something inappropriate. I am truly disappointed. I hope next time the shop will inform customers in advance about pre-orders. I will never return.

eng_comment:
My friend often buys cakes through the shop's app and shares them with me. The quality of the cakes is relatively good compared to other shops. However, recently, the two of us had the chance to pass by the shop, so we stopped in to buy directly. After that, we decided not to return due to health reasons.

I don't dislike pets, but my field of study is not compatible with having pets in places that sell food. When we visited the shop, I saw a dog lying on the table! It seemed like there were 2-3 dogs in the shop at that time.

The shop seems too lenient or unaware of the safety and hygiene issues when allowing customers to freely bring pets into the bakery like that. I'm worried about the dogs' fur possibly lingering on the chairs. What if I sit at that table to eat and drink?

I'm really sorry because the quality of the cakes is fine, but in terms of overall hygiene, it's...

eng_comment:
- When you step inside, you'll notice a faint buttery aroma. There are two pastry areas: one at the counter on the left as soon as you enter and another at the checkout counter.
- The pastries are fragrant, crispy, and evenly coated with salted egg yolk sauce. I bought directly from the shop, so the staff warmed up the pastries before handing them to me.
- The roll croissants here are very popular, so you need to order in advance. On the day I visited, there were extra pistachio ones, so I was able to buy them immediately. The staff only fill the pastries with cream when you're ready to eat.
- The pastries have a lot of creamy filling, which is rich, but I don't think pistachio suits my taste.
- There is seating available (about 3 sofas) and they also serve drinks, but I don't think the shop is suitable for a long stay. It's mainly for takeout.
- The owner and the staff are very friendly.
- You can park in front of the shop and lock your bike yourself as there is no security.
- Overall, it was a pretty decent experience for me.

eng_comment:
‚ùóÔ∏è‚ùóÔ∏è‚ùóÔ∏è STAFF ATTITUDE DOESN'T NEED CUSTOMERS ‚ùóÔ∏è‚ùóÔ∏è‚ùóÔ∏è
Today, I stopped by a bakery on my way home to try some cakes. The shop had few staff, so I had to wait quite a while.
- When it was my turn, I pointed to a cake in the display and asked: "What filling does this cake have?"
- The staff member replied: "Have you ordered the cake yet?"
- I said: "I haven't ordered yet."
- The staff member responded: "Then don't look down at that display." (Such a strange attitude, I couldn't believe someone could say this to a customer)
- The shop isn't very big, but the staff's attitude is very DISRESPECTFUL TO CUSTOMERS.
- I will never return!!
